Deficiency Narrative: During the monitoring inspection, one child's medication record had an inaccurate medication count.
Correction Narrative: The operation is conducting nightly medication counts at this point as well as weekly audits to ensure any errors are caught and corrected.  There is a staff meeting scheduled for 06/23/25 to discuss medication concerns as well.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation it was discovered during interviews and documentation, the victim child was on increased supervision and could not be with two residents without staff presence. Three residents reported staff was not present to intervene when the incident occurred. The staff reported two residents went to the victim's aid, while the staff put up chemicals. One of the residents that went to check on the victim was listed on the victim's safety plan, as to not be with this peer without staff supervision.
Correction Narrative: On 5/5/2025 Training for all staff Serious Incident Reporting, training for expectations of staff before, during, and after an incident. On 5/12/2025 Hope Haven will provide a training to all staff titled Appropriate Youth De-escalation, Staff Intervention, and Supervision. A follow up inspection will be conducted on 5/7/2025.  A follow up inspection will be conducted on 5/7/2025. An unannounced follow-up inspection (4056632) was conducted on 5/13/2025. Training sign in logs were provided and two staff and one child interviewed. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered through interviews the staff on duty failed to intervene during the incident allowing two residents to witness, control, and de-escalate a traumatic incident with a peer, while staff was instructed by residents to remain outside the bathroom. A child was allowed to have a prohibited item listed on the child's safety plan, after the staff found a plan written by the child to harm oneself with the prohibited item.
Correction Narrative: On 5/5/2025 Training for all staff Serious Incident Reporting, training for expectations of staff before, during, and after an incident. On 5/12/2025 Hope Haven will provide a training to all staff titled Appropriate Youth De-escalation, Staff Intervention, and Supervision. A follow up inspection will be conducted on 5/7/2025. An unannounced follow-up inspection (4056632) was conducted on 5/13/2025. Training sign in logs were provided and two staff and one child interviewed. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation weekly screenings for the first thirty days were requested; however, they were not provided. After discussion with the administrator, it was reported the screenings were not in the operation's online records. Therefore, the administrator inquired if the screenings had been completed; however, there has not been a response provided.
Correction Narrative: The operation has designated this task to the Treatment Director to follow up on all ASQ screenings for residents at admission, every 90 days and weekly for 30 days following inpatient stay. The Suicide Prevention policy was discussed on 5/2/2025.  A follow up inspection will be conducted on 5/7/2025. An unannounced follow-up inspection (4056632) was conducted on 5/13/2025. Training sign in logs were provided and two staff and one child interviewed. There were no concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was discovered in the kitchen freezer an uncovered cup with lemon drink and an uncovered bowl of ice cream. The house manager removed and disposed of these items during the inspection.

A child was placed at the operation on 5/23/2024. According to the Common App, the child was prescribed Abilify/Aripiprazole on 5/6/2025, prior to placement. According to documents provided by the operation and interviews, the child was never administered Abilify, in error. The operation was not able to provide medication records to reflect the child was administered the prescribed medication.
Correction Narrative: On 5/2/2025, the operation's Administrator advised the RN created an entire new medication auditing system and training. This training has been completed for all staff at least once; some have attended twice.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was referred to follow up in one month for allergies, blood pressure, and to get a flu shot. The operation was not able to provide documentation to reflect the follow-up visit was completed.
Correction Narrative: On 4/25/2025, the operation's Administrator advised they have implemented a new system to ensure that follow-up visits are scheduled and completed in a timely manner. After a medical appointment the Case Manager is required to upload the document within 3 business days. Upon reviewing the document for accuracy, it is the responsibility of the case manager to schedule any necessary follow-up appointments also within 3 business days. We also have a new TEAMS channel where all appointment AVS will be loaded for review for leadership to keep track. It is also a new practice that all efforts to schedule appointments, appointment changes, any issues and necessary communication regarding medical appointments are to be documented in the monthly case manager notes.  If the Case Manager has an issue that cannot be resolved, they must alert their supervisor.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was seen by medical personnel for an annual physical and referred to an optometrist in September 2024. The child was seen by an optometrist in October 2024; glasses were ordered and ready for pick-up within 3 weeks, however, operation staff did not pick-up the glasses until nearly 5 months later in March 2025.
Correction Narrative: On 4/25/2025, the operation's Administrator advised they have implemented a new system to ensure that follow-up visits are scheduled and completed in a timely manner. After a medical appointment the Case Manager is required to upload the document within 3 business days. Upon reviewing the document for accuracy, it is the responsibility of the case manager to schedule any necessary follow-up appointments also within 3 business days. We also have a new TEAMS channel where all appointment AVS will be loaded for review for leadership to keep track. It is also a new practice that all efforts to schedule appointments, appointment changes, any issues and necessary communication regarding medical appointments are to be documented in the monthly case manager notes.  If the Case Manager has an issue that cannot be resolved, they must alert their supervisor.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was referred to periodontics for gingival recession during a dental visit in October 2024. At the time of the investigation initial visit in March 2025, the child had yet to complete the periodontic visit. The operation reported issues with the referral and insurance, however, were not able to provide documentation to reflect continued efforts to get the child's referral completed in a timely manner.
Correction Narrative: On 4/25/2025, the operation's Administrator provided documentation to reflect the child completed a routine dental check up on 3/25/2025. The child also completed an orthodontist initial evaluation on 4/1/2025.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, medication records were reviewed and one record did not include the name of staff who administered the medication.
Correction Narrative: On 2/24/2025, during an inspection at the operation, the medication record was reviewed, and corrections were observed.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to report the quarterly EBI data timely.
Correction Narrative: The operation reported there were staffing changes to the individual responsible for submitting the EBI quarterly report. The Program Manager now has a login to the provider website and will take over the responsibility of reporting the operation's quarterly EBI.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident reports were reviewed for HHS Investigation 3128973, and it was observed the documentation was lacking required information such as the operation's physical address, telephone number, and the treating physician's name, findings, and treatment. The operation was cited on 12/12/2024 and provided a comply by date of 12/18/2024. The operation failed to show compliance, timely.
Correction Narrative: On 1/10/2025, Hope Haven's Program Manager provided the requested corrections: Case Managers were notified of inaccurate information in records and were asked to complete a thorough audit of all records to ensure accuracy in information and make any necessary corrections, case managers were asked to thoroughly review any future documents before submitting the document for review in our electronic records system, which will require a supervisor final approval. Should the supervisor find any inaccurate information the document will be sent back for corrections prior to approval. Furthermore, all documents are currently being reviewed by Hope Havens Client Service Manager and all documents will be reviewed, and any necessary changes will be completed by 1/17/2025. This will ensure that all documents are accurate and meet requirements moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: Completed supervision check forms were reviewed for HHS Investigation 3128973, and it was observed the operation was not following supervision checks per the child's safety plan; the operation failed to check on the child every 15 minutes on multiple occasions on 11/18/2024 and 11/19/2024. The child was interviewed and corroborated the discrepancy. The operation was cited on 12/12/2024 and provided a comply by date of 12/18/2024. The operation failed to show compliance, timely.
Correction Narrative: On 1/10/2025, Hope Haven's Program Manager provided the requested corrections: Residential Manager, now sends out all required check forms to staff daily to include all safety and supervision plans for each resident. These checks are also reviewed by the residential manager prior to being loaded into the electronic system. All staff were asked on 1/7/2025 to ensure that these check logs clearly identify if a child is out of the home while on 15-minute checks. Safety and Supervision plans are accessible to find in 3 different areas now, when before it was only 2 places to remind staff the necessary checks. Staff will be reminded of this at the required staff meeting on Monday 1/13/25.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation has not yet met compliance with this standard as a refresher course in their EBI system has not yet been conducted with staff.  The administrator confirmed it has not yet been completed, and the operation is seeking an instructor to meet this need.
Correction Narrative: The operation has not yet met compliance with this standard as a refresher course in their EBI system has not yet been conducted with staff.  The administrator confirmed it has not yet been completed, and the operation is seeking an instructor to meet this need.

Deficiency Narrative: The administrator confirmed he would not be providing RCCR with a schedule showing his presence at the operation under advisement of his supervisor.  The operation has not yet offered correction for this standard, and the administrator noted the standard is currently in Administrative Review with a hearing upcoming.  As such, compliance for this standard has not yet been met.
Correction Narrative: The administrator confirmed he would not be providing RCCR with a schedule showing his presence at the operation under advisement of his supervisor.  The operation has not yet offered correction for this standard, and the administrator noted the standard is currently in Administrative Review with a hearing upcoming.  As such, compliance for this standard has not yet been met.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered through child and staff interviews that a staff member was not confidential in discussing with a child in care's skin checks with the child in front of other children. The child asked the staff to speak with her privately as it shocked her that the staff would discuss this with her in front of her peers.
Correction Narrative: The operation indicated a disciplinary action/write up was given to the staff due to confidentiality breach for the child. The operation provided a copy of the Employee Disciplinary Action Form. A copy of the disciplinary form is uploaded in Document Libaray.

Deficiency Narrative: During the course of the investigation, two children in care reported staff grabbed a child by the arm and snatched a hot pocket out of the child's hand. The child and the staff began to argue, with the child telling staff not to touch her, which escalated the child and as a result the child destroyed the kitchen. There is video footage that supports the staff grabbed the child's arm. There was a previous incident before with this child and staff in which the child was cooking and staff grabbed the child's arm stating the staff wanted to show the child something. The child told staff at that time not to touch the child, and the child didn't want to be touched.
Correction Narrative: The operation will provide a training to all staff on 1/13/2025 title "Understanding the Reasonable and Prudent Parent Standard. An outline of the training was provided. A training will be provided at staff meeting on 1/27/2025 regarding communication and include reminders about body language, tone of voice, expression, etc. RCCR Supervisor gave permission to close this investigation and review training logs for both trainings during a Plan of Action inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was evaluated in follow-up to Investigation #3121194, and the agency has not yet conducted an EBI refresher course including the restraint positions identified in the policies and procedures.

During the investigation, a child reported the operation was not following supervision checks per the safety plan. A review of the completed supervision check forms corroborated the child's allegations. The operation failed to check on the child every 15 minutes multiple times on 11/18/2024 and 11/19/2024.

During the investigation, serious incident reports were reviewed, and it was observed the documentation was lacking required information such as the operation's physical address and the treating physician's name, finding, and treatment.

During the course of the investigation, a child in care was observed by staff picking up a marijuana roach. The staff told the child multiple times to drop the roach; however, the child did not. The staff witnessed the child walk around to multiple people at the park asking for a lighter; as well as asking the staff. The staff had the children load the van, because the child would not dispose of the roach. The child pretended to throw the roach out the window; and the staff believed she did. After returning to the operation, it was discovered that the child had not disposed of the roach as she was attempting to light it. The staff failed to obtain possession of the roach to ensure it was disposed of. The staff failed to check to see if the child actually disposed the roach.
Correction Narrative: The operation conducted a training for staff to review the Reasonable and Prudent Parenting standard with staff and a knowledge test was given. The training also discussed person and room searches reviewing different scenarios and proper documentation. A sign-in sheet of attendees for this training was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the adminstrator was not present at the operation during the inspection, exhibits a historical pattern of not being present at the operation, and interviews indicate he is present at the operation only for staff meetings.

During the inspection, I observed a child's prescription Iron Supplement was not refilled in a timely fashion, resulting in the child missing a dose of her medication on 10/14/24.  The Administrator confirmed the responsible staff admitted to failing to pick the prescription up before the medication ran out.
Correction Narrative: During the inspection, interviewed the RN on staff for the operation and observed the new system for refills put in place for the operation.  New prescriptions are put in a refill box that is tracked by a specific log.  The day staff picks up refills when available each day.  The RN audits the medication logs every week, and Night staff audits the med logs over night to ensure they remain accurate.  The staff received training on this refill system and medication management in September.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, I confirmed two staff members did not receive EBI training within six months of their previous training.
During the inspection, three of the four child medication records reviewed were missing the reason the medication was prescribed. This was corrected at inspection.

During the inspection, it was discovered a toilet would not flush in one of the bathrooms in which three girls share. There is a do not use sign on the toilet. There is a work order for this toilet dated 6/8/2024, which appears to have been ample time for this toilet to have been fixed.
Correction Narrative: The operation has received multiple quotes for repair but they are unsure of the timeline for the work to be completed. An immediate corrective plan is to not utilize the two rooms that share the adjoining bathroom, until it is repaired. An inspection was conducted on 10/24/2024, and the two rooms are not being utilized.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was discovered that one of the four child medication records reviewed indicated a child had missed a dose on four days.
Correction Narrative: The operation held a medication training on 9/30/2024 and 10/4/2024. A trained staff is conducting weekly audits on medication. An inspection was conducted on 10/24/2024 and two child records were reviewed and found to be compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: The name and signature of of each staff administering medicaitons was not present.  One staff's signature was illegible, and several medication counts were prefilled (without initials or signatures).
Correction Narrative: Trainings were done on medication records and PRN medications. Document Library has the corrections.

Deficiency Narrative: A direct care staff was yelling and shaking her finger in the face of a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Email by Paul Christman stated the staff involved subsequently resigned from Hope Haven, and the operation had a training for all other employees on inappropriate discipline, including yelling and shaming. Sign in sheets have been sent and uploaded.

Deficiency Narrative: During this investigation, it was discovered during interviews children in care have been making out with each other in their beds and bedrooms. Five of the five children interviewed girls have played kissing games. Two of the five girls reported making out in the bed together in their bedroom. Four of the seven collateral adults interviewed reported visiting the operation several times a week and observing concerns regarding supervision.
Correction Narrative: A general training with Direct Care Staff regarding appropriate supervision will be conducted during the work week of August 12, 2024. The training will emphasis the operation's policies regarding routine bed check and the appropriating of increase supervision plans if suspected high risk behavior is possible. They are also reviewing for emergency and disaster management to revise the supervision standards necessary during abnormal operating conditions. The policy will be finalized by August 26, 2024

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four employee records reviewed did not contain orientation training.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance with this standard by confirming that the staff had completed the training and the operation also reviewed other staff files to ensure nothing was missed with them as well. T

Deficiency Narrative: The first aid kit in the Hope Haven Hilander was missing waterproof gloves, a thermometer, and tweezers.  A case manager added the missing items during the monitoring inspection.

A caregiver failed to follow the operation's approved policies and procedures. According to the operation's electronic and social media policy only authorized staff can handle these concerns. An off duty, unauthorized staff member provided a child with a history of social media abuse the password to social media.
Correction Narrative: The individual who violated the policy was suspended from work during the investigation and subsequently terminated as an employee. Training on the Hope Haven Technology Policy has occurred with Direct Care, Supervisory, and Management staff, and they all have been sent an electronic copy of the Hope Haven Technology Policy. A sign in sheet from the training reflecting those that attended.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, I observed the facility first aid kit to be lacking a pair of tweezers.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a photograph via email showing the added pair of tweezers to the first aid kit.  This brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: During an abuse/neglect investigation it was noted that while a staff was playing with a child in care, the staff in a non-disciplinary manner, touched the child on her bottom, making a comment to the effect that the staff was bad. This was confirmed by another staff in a written incident report. Two collateral children were interviewed indicating this staff previously "touched or smacked" one of the two residents on the bottom.
Correction Narrative: On 1/5/2024, the staff was retrained on proper and prudent actions to take when supervising children, including that touching on the bottom regardless of the innocent intent of such action is inappropriate. A signed training log for the Boundaries between childcare workers and children in care was provided. The training was an hour long.

Deficiency Narrative: Interviews with staff and children indicate three children were allowed unsupervised access to a personal laptop, with one child requiring increased supervision due to recent behaviors.
Correction Narrative: On 2/14/24, the operation submitted documentation of updated technology policies stating the supervision expectations regarding children's technology use and a parameter to include specific technology allowances and restrictions in the children's service plans.  The operation also presented a training schedule covering this information to be completed before the end of the month.  This establishes proper supervision of children accordant to their specific needs documented in the service plan as well as general expectations and brings this standard into compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four records reviewed failed to have a child's signature indicating the child's rights had been reviewed. There was no signature nor was there an explanation of why the child did not sign. The agency provided another copy of the child's right form for this child that indicated the form was signed eleven months later.
Correction Narrative: The operation has modified their intake process to verify all forms are in compliance with a standard check list maintained in the electronic records.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the fire drills, it was noted that only one drill had been conducted this year. The drill was conducted in January 2023, and there has not been a follow up drill completed. Staff reported the severe weather and fire drill were both completed at the same time in January 2023.
Correction Narrative: The operation conducted a fire drill with the residents in care on 12/1/2023 and provided a copy of the drill. The operation has modified their electronic records to automatically send the due date for the next required drill.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of the four child records reviewed were missing service plan reviews. One of the records had the initial service plan only. Another record was missing one service plan review.
Correction Narrative: The operation modified their Service Plan procedure to require Case Managers to upload service plans and track compliance with electronic records. The operation created a review process by the Legal and Regulatory Manager to approve all Service Plans.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing the severe weather drills, it was noted that only one drill had been conducted this year. The drill was conducted in January 2023, and there has not been a follow up drill completed. Staff reported the severe weather and fire drill were both completed at the same time in January 2023.
Correction Narrative: The operation completed the weather drill on 11/30/2023, with the children in care. The operation has modified the electronic records to automatically send the due date for the next required drill.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the four records did not include documentation in the child's record indicating the child's parent had been notified of the service plan meeting.
Correction Narrative: The operation has modified their electronic record system to require inclusion notices and service plans. If the task is not completed the records will be flagged with a non-compliance indicator for management review.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was told to stand in the restroom and turn around while a child used the restroom.  This made both the child and the caregiver uncomfortable.
During the investigation, it was discovered that the operation did not follow their plans to restrict medication administration by a staff member after a medication error.
Correction Narrative: On 12/19/2023, the Director, Paul Christman, provided corrections: Hope Haven has issued new policies and procedures to require that that all restrictions to the normal duties of Direct Care Staff must be issued in writing by the Residential Manager, Program and/or Administrator.  All restrictions in duties must be clearly communicated by the Residential Manager to the employee.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered that a caregiver was leaving staff keys accessible to children and leaving the staff office door and medication closet opened and accessible to children.
Correction Narrative: On 12/19/2023, the Director, Paul Christman, provided corrections: Ms. Human has undergone retraining on proper security and management of medication and responsible action to take when interruptions occur during medication dispensing hours.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered that a caregiver playfully spanked a child on the bottom making the child feel weird about the situation.
Correction Narrative: On 12/19/2023, the Director, Paul Christman, provided corrections: Ms. Human has undergone retraining on proper and prudent actions to take when supervising children including that touching on the bottom regardless of the innocent intent of such action is inappropriate.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was discovered that a caregiver was yelling, screaming, and/or cursing at the children,
Correction Narrative: On 12/19/2023, the Director, Paul Christman, provided corrections: Ms. Human has undergone retraining on proper behavior intervention without using language that would be considered yelling or screaming. Ms. Human will also be included in the Pressley Ridge Professional Parenting class on de-escalation of children at the next session.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation inspection, the administrator was not present at the operation. The administrator has not been present at the operation the last few times Licensing has been to the operation.
Correction Narrative:
Executive Director, Jamie Sanders, advised the operation requires its Administrator, Mr. Billy Roberson, to hold a current Child Care Administrators License and to work full-time for the operation.  He oversees compliance with minimum standards, contract requirements, and internal policies and procedures.  He oversees both residential operations and therapeutic services, participating in staff meetings, treatment team meetings, and program leadership meetings.  He participates in placement and discharge decisions.  He, along with the Treatment Director, oversees safety and service planning, and interacts regularly with staff, residents, and state officials.

His duties require him to be present at the Gateway of Hope campus and also at our administrative offices which are located approximately 20 minutes from the actual home.  At any given time, he may be at the campus meeting with children, reviewing service plans, meeting with staff or program leadership, or he may be at the administrative office regarding training, legal and regulatory issues, finance, budget meetings, or community relations. The administrator does not maintain his work office in the home, but is present in the home regularly for meetings, crisis intervention, communication with staff and state officials, and training responsibilities. Additionally, Mr. Roberson is present for meetings, placement decisions, treatment decisions, and leadership collaboration at Hope Haven's administrative offices. He is available to staff and leadership by phone and email twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week and is consistently responsive to every call and request, providing leadership, advice, and supervision on a daily basis. Any time a state official has requested to meet with or speak to Mr. Roberson, he has been available.

Hope Haven will continue to require its administrator to provide supervision and direction for the operation in a manner that ensures the safety and well-being of the children served and the overall excellence of the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: A follow-up inspection was conducted at the operation regarding an ANE investigation in which this standard was cited. The operation reported as a correction that a training had been conducted on 10/6/2023. The administrator reported the training had been conducted, however, there was no sign-in sheet to provide evidence the training had actually took place. The administrator stated the staff that led the training is no longer employed with the operation, and he was not aware if a sign-in sheet was completed.
Correction Narrative: The operation held a training regarding prohibited items and confiscation of prohibited items. This training was held on 10/23/2023, and a sign-in sheet was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation, it was observed that the operation did not notify the parent about the child's serious injury, which resulted in seeking medical attention, until the following day and not directly after ensuring the child was safe.
Correction Narrative: Executive Director, Jamie Sanders, provided an email advising the operation will comply with requirements of minimum standards in reporting any serious incident to licensing, parents, or law enforcement.  When an injury occurs to a child resulting in a serious injury and medical treatment, licensing and the CPS Caseworker will be notified in a timely manner. An admin review was requested.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care and staff reported that children were allowed to possess and utilize personal sexual stimulators at the operation. A child in care admitted to using a personal sexual stimulator on another child while at the operation.
One of the four employee records reviewed had a transportation training that was at least three weeks late.
Correction Narrative:
The operation sent out an email to new hires to ensure completion of the required tasks. The Human Resources Director will send a list of online classes to staff. The training team will check with the new hires throughout the week to ensure completion of all items before their training is complete. If the trainings are not completed the new hire will be asked to stay later to complete the trainings, before being offered to complete job-shadowing hours in the home. 

In addition, the electronic records system will be modified to notify the employee and supervisor, to update/renew training requirements prior to expiration.

If the trainings are not completed the new hire will be asked to stay later to complete the trainings, before being offered to complete job-shadowing hours in the home.
